intro: Elatostema longibracteatum var. glabricaule, commonly known as the smooth-stemmed elatostema, is a species of flowering plant in the family Melastomataceae. It is native to regions of Southeast Asia, including parts of Thailand and Malaysia. The plant is characterized by its slender, glabrous stems and small, clustered leaves. Its flowers are typically white or pink, with five petals and numerous stamens, making it visually distinctive. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest undergrowth.
